abstract: While banks like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have enough liquidity to consider raising dividends or buying back stock, regulators have told U.S. banks to preserve their cash for the moment, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: While banks like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have enough liquidity to consider raising dividends or buying back stock, regulators have told U.S. banks to preserve their cash for the moment, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: While banks like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have enough liquidity to consider raising dividends or buying back stock, regulators have told U.S. banks to preserve their cash for the moment, The Financial Times reported, citing unidentified sources.

headline.main: U.S. Regulators Said to Tell Banks to Keep Cash
